attributes.action: Reform or Repeal the 'Isle of Wight Act'
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The IW Act was originally introduced after the 1970 Festival at Afton, which attracted around 600,000 people and Brian Hinton, official historian for the IW Festival, said: "My great worry is that various vested interests in the council are trying to destroy an event which has done so much to rebrand the Island."

This year is the 1st year that the IW Council have implimented this act that looks likely to cost the promoters Solo an extra £250,000 once again putting the Festivals future in doubt. 

We are hoping that by signing this petition we can raise our concerns and get this act abolished or adapted.
